person.persName: John N. Furber (Brooksville, Kentucky, and Covington, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Brooksville, Kentucky, and Covington, Kentucky, attorney. Northwood, New Hampshire native. Son of Joshua Furber and Alcey Neally Furber. Married to Margaret A. Linn Furber in 1845. Father of Neally L. Furber. Married to Martha M. Smith Furber on July 23, 1857. Father of Charles S. Furber, Anna M. L. Furber, and Martha L. Furber. Moved to Mason County, Kentucky, in 1837. Teacher at a private school in Mason County in the late-1830s. Moved to Brooksville in 1840. Admitted to the bar in Bracken County, Kentucky, in 1840. Delegate to the National Democratic Convention in 1844. Attorney in Bracken County in 1850 and 1860. Moved to Covington in 1865. Attorney in Covington in 1865.
